explanation: The report is correct. The helper lfs_mlist_isopen only inspects the list and does not modify any nodes, yet its parameters and internal pointer-to-pointer are non-const. MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 requires pointers to point to const-qualified types when modification is not required. The function can be safely changed to use const-qualified parameters and a const-pointer loop (for example: static bool lfs_mlist_isopen(const struct lfs_mlist *head, const struct lfs_mlist *node) { for (const struct lfs_mlist *p = head; p; p = p->next) if (p == node) return true; return false; }). The cast in the caller (struct lfs_mlist*)node also masks const-correctness and should be removed after fixing the signature. Therefore the reported violation of Rule 8.13 is valid.
